creator: Matthew Mizrahi
title: Bentzi Led
description: This project allows you to control the color of an RGB LED using a potentiometer. By turning the potentiometer, you can change the values of red, green, and blue light emitted from the LED, creating a range of different colors.
steps: Connect the potentiometer to the Arduino. The middle leg connects to analog pin A0.
Connect the LEDs to the Arduino. The green LED to pin 9, the blue LED to pin 10, and the red LED to pin 11.
Upload the provided code to the Arduino board.
The code defines pins for the potentiometer and the LEDs, and sets up the serial communication.
The code reads the analog value from the potentiometer and maps it to a range of 0-255 for each color (red, green, blue).
The mapped color values are then used to control the brightness of each LED using the analogWrite function.
Adjust the potentiometer to change the color of the LED.
Modify the values in the map function in the code to change the color ranges.
